Description: Razmnama, or Book of War, copied in the late 16th century at the Mughal court, was the Persian translation commissioned by the emperor Akbar of the Sanskrit epic text, the Mahabharata. This Sanskrit text was translated by order of the emperor Akbar so that the Persian-speaking Muslims of his court could understand the major texts of Hinduism.
Title: "Vyasa and Shuka"
